page.title: 04HOOK ACTION GROUP
page.content: August 1983 saw the announcement that a mini_town was to be built to the north of Hook. The village was very much aware of the rapid expansion it was undergoing and inhabitants felt that this addition would cause unacceptable social strain on the village.An action group -H.A.G.- was formed to monitor and combat the extra development. The action group has succeeded in fighting off a consortium of national housebuilders by informing and involving local people and lobbying the government. Local developers, Charles Church,have taken over the site and are waiting for planning permission. The proposal is for 5,000 houses, complete with schools, shops and community buildings but no more office developments.
